summary: The documents provided do not directly link William C. Sullivan to the JFK assassination. Instead, they focus on the FBI's response to the U.S. Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC) requests for information, particularly concerning Martin Luther King, Jr., and the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC). Sullivan's role appears to be related to the FBI's internal operations and responses to external inquiries from the Senate Select Committee. The documents detail the FBI's efforts to locate and provide requested materials, as well as instances where materials could not be found. One document references an interview conducted by the Senate Select Committee (SSC) with former Assistant Director Ivan Conrad, along with FBI Special Agent William D. Campbell, concerning FBI investigations, specifically related to Martin Luther King Jr. and electronic surveillance activities.
key_connections: U.S. Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC)
significance: Based on the provided documents, William C. Sullivan's significance is related to his involvement in FBI activities and responses to Senate inquiries regarding intelligence matters, particularly concerning Martin Luther King, Jr., and the SCLC, rather than any direct connection to the JFK assassination.
